title: Can anyone identify these fonts?
tags: Can anyone identify these Amazing fonts?
author: NeonPurple

comments.content:
"Eatopia": [Alpine Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/charlesborges/alpine-script/)  
"youthathon": a [Tektrron](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.dafont.com/tektrron.font), slightly customized, could work  
"quipio": hard to say, customized (finials curved), very generic (non distinctive, even boring to me) and too few letters. From hand-drawn to any geometric sans, including freebie. Some: [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/futura/), [Avant-Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde/), [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/helvetica/), [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/typophile.com/wiki/%5B%5Bhttp%3A/%252Fwww.myfonts.com/search/avenir/), [Raleway](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.google.com/webfonts/specimen/Raleway), [Nexa](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/fontfabric.com/nexa-free-font/)... Your best chance is probably asking to [Sumesh](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Quipio/6058507)  
"ONSBAY": [Lithos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017100638/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/lithos/)
Thankyou so much Man, i think quipio might be modification of Harbara.

> i think quipio might be modification of Harbara.

I don’t think so. But Harabara is a modification of Helvetica Bold.

If the "quipio" font is in fact a mod of Harabara it's best to avoid it, since Harabara itself most likely involved outline theft (as Jan kindly hints at).

hhp
but there is no other close font , may be this time i need to design shapes & paths without plagiarising the font.

Well, if all you need to set is "quipio" then I would start with a rendering of Futura or Avant Garde and modify away. If you need a whole font, and you're up to making the effort, modify Futura or Avant Garde, just make totally sure it never leaves your hard drive.

BTW, using a plagiarized font isn't plagiarism itself; it's just... inconsiderate. :-)

hhp
